2017 WW21-WW22 NFVi Silver Release Announcement (\r\n BKC #10)

\r\n \r\n \r\n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\r\n \r\n
\r\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW21-WW22 NFVi Silver release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\r\n \r\n Ubuntu14.04.5/\r\n \r\n Ubuntu16.04.1\r\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Ren, Shu.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server

\r\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu14_44.121350-2017WW21.zip\r\n \r\n
\r\n
Ubuntu16.04.1WithoutOS_BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu16_16.121350-2017WW21.zip\r\n \r\n
Ubuntu16.04.1.zip\r\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-NFVi_Ubuntu16_16.121350-2017WW21.zip\r\n \r\n
Ubuntu16.04.1.zip\r\n
\r\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

Key Updates

\xc2\xb7       \r\nPlease refer to the HW/SW ingredient table for detailed\r\nconfiguration

\xc2\xb7       \r\nTotal test cases: 50; Attempted test cases: 50 (Attempted\r\nrate: 100%); Passed test cases: 50 and pass rate is 100.00%. Please visit  HPQC for test details

\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n

\xc2\xb7       WAR for "watchdog error when install Ubuntu OS after flash\r\nBMC from 0.71.d8978c76"  has been applied into BKC, refer to WAR for details


Release Note

\xc2\xb7       Ubuntu14.04.5 is\r\nreleases with kernel 3.13.0-100 generic, only contain the SW package, no\r\nauto-installer support, semi-auto installation step as below:

\xc2\xa7  Install\r\nUbuntu14.04.5 Server

\xc2\xa7  Download\r\nthe SW package and unzip it, Copy the APP folder to /opt/ of target SUT

\xc2\xa7  Navigate\r\nto /opt/APP/script, run update_kernel.sh to update kernel to 3.13.0-100, reboot\r\nthe system 

\xc2\xa7  Navigate\r\nto /opt/APP/script, run setup.sh to install required libs and SW dependencies

\xc2\xa7  Note: All SW ingredients\r\nare installed after running setup.sh, refer to README for installation details

\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n

\xc2\xb7      \r\nUbuntu16.04.1 is released\r\nas auto-installer, refer to Auto-Installation\r\nGuide for installation details

None\r\n

InformationQuick Guide
BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website:  https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Click on "Add or Remove access"
  • Navigate to:"BKC \xe2\x80\x93 NFVi"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Ren, Shu

BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication
